events.comment: Work-around so that gravity doesn't start pulling objects before joints can be created

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/), D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Users can click on the checkbox to add and remove the checkmark. 

How to use:
- Add this extension to a shape painter object
- Use condition "Is checked" to find out the state of the checkbox

Tips:
- Checkbox state can also be changed by an action.
- Checkbox can be disabled so that users cannot interact with it 
- To remove halo, Set "halo hover" and "halo pressed" opacity to 0
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Checkbox
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Checkbox that can be toggled by a left-click or touch.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/), D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Draws a draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
The value range, tick spacing, and the appearance of the slider can be defined with properties.

How to use:
- Add this behavior a **Shape Painter** object
- Place an instance of that shape painter on the screen where you want the slider to appear
- Use the "Value" expression to find the Value based on the position of the slider

Tips:
- You can disable the slider to prevent a user from interacting with it
- You can set the Value of the slider and the slider will move to the correct position

Further details can be found in [this tutorial video](https://youtu.be/iiTUwdAT_hs).

Breaking changes (1.0.0)
- Track thickness and length properties replaced track width and height. These 2 properties must be set again if they were different from the default size.
- Hidden sliders can be dragged. The "enable" action must be used to disable them.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggableSliderControl
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let users select a numerical value by dragging a slider.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggableSliderControl

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Jeroen Erkens, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This action is meant to be run on every frame.  Normal conditions to select which objects you want to stay inside the camera view.

- Use an object group to track multiple objects.
- Only run on one layer at a time.  If multiple layers need to move the same way, use the "Copy Camera Settings" extension.
- This can also be used with a single object instance to move the camera smoothly.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FollowObjectsWithCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Change the zoom and position of the camera to keep all instances of an object (or object group) on the screen.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the zoom and position of the camera to keep all instances of an object (or object group) on the screen.
eventsFunctions.name: FollowObjectsWithCamera
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move camera on layer _PARAM6_ to keep instances of _PARAM1_ on the screen. Use a margin of _PARAM2_px horizontally and _PARAM3_px vertically. Use a zoom between _PARAM4_ and _PARAM5_.  Move the camera at a speed of _PARAM8_

events.comment: Set default values if nothing is entered
Set initial values based on an object instance.  This is used as a valid starting point for comparisons, so it doesn't matter which instance is used.

Loop through every instance of object (or object group) and determine the max position values used for left, right, top and bottom.
Record the height and width of the objects that are on the edges.  These values will be used to increase the camera viewport to include the entire object.
Move camera to the center location
Zoom in or out to keep all object instances on screen
Adjust zoom to stay within min/max values
Change camera zoom

parameters.name: MaxZoom

parameters.name: Layer

parameters.longDescription: Percent of distance to destination that will be travelled each frame (used by lerp function)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Enables users to click and drag on objects to move them.  The object will retain velocity when the click is released, which can allow users to fling objects across the screen.

Note:
- The standard "draggable" behavior will not work on objects that have the physics behavior. This extension should be used instead.
- This extension will only work on objects that have the physics behavior.
- Kinematic physics mode is incompatible with this extension. The object will be changed to dynamic mode.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggablePhysics
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Drag a physics object with the mouse (or touch).
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggablePhysics

* fog of wars
* liquids effects (water, blobs, lava)
* dynamically paint territories
* other effects based on "contour lines"

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @Bouh, D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension provides: 
- Conditions to check if a global/scene/object variable exists.
- Actions to copy object variables, global and scene variables.
- Actions to delete an existing global/scene variable from memory.
- Actions to create a global/scene variable using a text expression, rather than a variable name input.
- Expressions to get the value or text from a global/scene variable using a text expression, rather than a variable name.

Text expressions allows to enter the name of the variable with an expression like `"MyVar"+ ToString(Variable(Health))`
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ExtendedVariables
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add conditions, actions and expressions to check for the existence of a variable, copy variables, delete existing ones from memory, and create dynamic variables.

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a global variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: C_global_variable_exist
eventsFunctions.sentence: If the global variable _PARAM1_ exist

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the global variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: GlobalVariableExist
eventsFunctions.sentence: If the global variable _PARAM1_ exist

events.inlineCode:
const globalVariables = runtimeScene.getGame().getVariables();
eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = globalVariables.has(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("GlobalVariableName"));

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a scene variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: C_scene_variable_exist
eventsFunctions.sentence: If the scene variable _PARAM1_ exist

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the scene variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: SceneVariableExist
eventsFunctions.sentence: If the scene variable _PARAM1_ exist

events.inlineCode:
const sceneVariables = runtimeScene.getVariables();
eventsFunctionContext.returnValue = sceneVariables.has(eventsFunctionContext.getArgument("SceneVariableName"));

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: C_object_variable_exist
eventsFunctions.sentence: Object _PARAM1_ has object variable _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object variable exists.
eventsFunctions.name: ObjectVariableExist
eventsFunctions.sentence: Object _PARAM1_ has object variable _PARAM2_

parameters.name: GlobalVariableName

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This provides:
* "Can reach through links" conditions, useful to check if an object is linked to another through one or more other linked objects.
* a path finding movement behavior that uses objects links (instead of obstacles for the other behavior)

For instance, it can be helpful for grid-based games like:
* Match-3 (see BimBam example)
* Tactical (see Tactical example)
* City builders (see City Builder example)
* Point and click (bypass obstacles with a predetermined polygonal chain)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: LinkTools
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Conditions to use Linked Objects as a graph and a path finding movement behavior.

parameters.longDescription: The 2 objects can't be the same.
parameters.name: Neighbor

parameters.name: Neighbor

parameters.name: TargetObject

parameters.longDescription: Leave empty to make everything crossable with cost = 1. It looks in the variable children of linktools_Cost. No child means not crossable, the cost must be positive.
parameters.name: CostClass

parameters.description: if they can reach this object
parameters.name: TargetObject

parameters.longDescription: Leave empty to make everything crossable with cost = 1. It looks in the variable children of linktools_Cost. No child means not crossable, the cost can be 0 or 1.
